plang.parser

Class AbstractParser<T extends Node>

  • java.lang.Object
    • plang.parser.AbstractParser<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - the type to be returned from parse
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Parser
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AssignmentParser, CallParser, ExpressionParser, ExpressionsParser, FactorParser, IfParser, StatementParser, StatementsParser

    public abstract class AbstractParser<T extends Node>
extends java.lang.Object
implements Parser
    Abstract helper for implementing Parsers
    Author:
    Isak Karlsson

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      AbstractParser(AbstractParser<?> parser)
      Construct a parser from another AbstractParser and use its tokenizer and message handler and factories

      Construct a parser using a tokenizer, message handler and factories

        protected void flagError(Token token,
             java.lang.String message,
             java.lang.Object... args)
        Flag a syntax error using the current message handler. Same as: getMessageHandler().error(token, MessageType.SYNTAX_ERROR, message, args) Use sparsely (we don't want C++ error propagation)
        Parameters:

        message -
        args -

      • parse

        public Node parse(Token start)
        Most likely return a node of type T, but optimize(Node) might change that (to any suitable subtype) Don't rely on casting (which is most likely not useful). Don't override! Use executeParse(Token) instead to gain optimization using optimize(Node).
        Specified by:
        parse in interface Parser
        Returns:
        a node if hasFailed() == false otherwise null

      • parse

        Description copied from interface: Parser
        Generate a node that is part of the abstract syntax tree

      • optimize

        protected Node optimize(T node)
        Optimize by pruning unnecessary nodes. E.g. is ExpressionParser optimized to return an instance of TermNode if ExpressionNode.getRight() is null. This pattern should be used to improve interpretation speed.
        Parameters:
        node -
        Returns:

      • executeParse

        protected abstract T executeParse(Token start)
        Override with the actual parsing. Is called by parse(Token) before optimize(Node)
        Parameters:
        start -
        Returns:
